name: ferrochromium production, high-carbon, 55% Cr | ferrochromium, high-carbon, 55% Cr | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21188/documentation

This dataset is a copy of the South African dataset for Ferrochromium production. It is, for now, the best available representative of the GLO sector.;96% of total chrome ore production is used in metallurgical applications in 2014.                           High-carbon ferrochrome & charge chrome production represents 94% of global ferrochrome production in 2014.                                                                                                                              Around 3 quarters of ferrochrome production is used to produce stainless steel.                                     Chrome ore, ferrochrome and stainless steel are highly correlated.

Activities start includes the mining of the Chromium ore and its concentration and extraction operations

Activities ends with Ferrochrome produced to be traded globally. The vast majority of FeCr produced is charge chrome from China, South Africa, followed by Kazakhstan and India.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data were colleted over a perido of 5 years and 2015 was chosen as reference year.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is a copy of the South African dataset for Ferrochromium, hich caron, 55% Cr production. It is, for now, the best available representative of the GLO sector.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Ferrochrome or Charged chrome is a major product or Chromeâ€™s product line. Charged chrome is an iron and chromium alloy (55% Cr, 7% C, 4% Si) produced in open, submerged and DC arc furnaces. Submerged furnace ;Chromite ore consisting of iron oxides, chromium oxides, magnesium oxides and aluminium oxides mixed with carbon sources in batches for the endothermic reduction reactions (Visser, 2006). ;The aluminium and magnesium oxides have high melting temperature therefore fluxes of limestone, dolomite and quartz are applied to condition the slag phase for ease of tapping (Visser, 2006). The CO produced in submerged furnaces is burnt with oxygen to heat furnace feed. From the furnace slag is tapped. After tapping it is de-slagged, granulated, cast into ingots or transferred into the next phase of processing (Visser, 2006). ;Intermediate-carbon ferrochrome is processed from hot charge chrome slag. The product has a lower silicon and carbon content, less than 0.3% and 1.5% respectively. Figure below shows a diagram o the process. The hot slag charge chrome is transferred to a CLU converter where oxygen and on site generated steam (CO from closed furnace) blown in the bottom of the vessel. Burnt lime and dolomite are used to strip Si from the metal to from SiO2. As more CO is produced, the carbon content (C) content is decreases. When the slag suitable carbon grade the slag is tapped and thereafter granulated. The granulated product is the transported for export (Visser, 2006). ;
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The estimates for the global production of Ferrochrome, high carbon content (or Charge Chrome) were 10.594 Mtonnes in 2015 (International Chromium Development Association, www.icdacr.com).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is a copy of the South African dataset for Ferrochromium production. It is, for now, the best available representative of the GLO sector. Data on production have been taken from International Chromium Development Association.                                                                            Data for ZA is based on the Merafe-Glencore (ferrochrome producer) sustainability reports and the following other sources:  Creamer, M., 2016. Ferrochrome price in sharp rise, s.l.: Mining Weekly.
Pistorius, P., 2002. Reductant selection in ferro-alloy production: The case for the importance of dissolution in the metal. The Journal of the South African Institue of Mining and Metallurgy , 102(1), pp. 33-36.                                                      
Visser, M., 2006. An overview of the history and current operational facilities of Samancor Chrome. Southern African Pyrometallurgy , pp. 285-296.
Xstrata, 2006. [Online] Available at: http://www.portsregulator.org/images/documents/XSTRATA_submission-Position_Paper_on_Beneficiation.pdf

exchanges.description: Ferrochrome or Charge chrome production. Values of RP and by-products are based on Merafe-Glencore production values (Merafe Sustainability Report (2016)).

exchanges.description:
This accounts specifically for Delisted metallurgical slag. 
Previously all mineral waste was stored together was not treated before disposal in specially designed faciliities on site. This made it legally claissified as hazardous material. Of late sludge which has a high concentration of Cr (VI) is treated before disposal. Slag constitutes most of the mineral waste, it is reprocessed when possible. Otherwise all mineral waste is stockpiled. Overburden is used for backfilling.

exchanges.description:
This accounts specifically for Quench ash. 
Previously all mineral waste was stored together was not treated before disposal in specially designed faciliities on site. This made it legally claissified as hazardous material. Of late sludge which has a high concentration of Cr (VI) is treated before disposal. Slag constitutes most of the mineral waste, it is reprocessed when possible. Otherwise all mineral waste is stockpiled. Overburden is used for backfilling.

exchanges.description:
This accounts specifically for Regulated slag. 
Previously all mineral waste was stored together was not treated before disposal in specially designed faciliities on site. This made it legally claissified as hazardous material. Of late sludge which has a high concentration of Cr (VI) is treated before disposal. Slag constitutes most of the mineral waste, it is reprocessed when possible. Otherwise all mineral waste is stockpiled. Overburden is used for backfilling.
